Package camzup.kotlin

Class KtVec4

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Vec4
camzup.kotlin.KtVec4
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Vec4>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
public class KtVec4
extends Vec4
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
Provides Kotlin operator overloading support for four dimensional vectors.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  KtVec4.V4Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a vector's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class camzup.core.Vec4

    Vec4.AbstrComparator, Vec4.AbstrEasing, Vec4.Lerp

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class camzup.core.Vec4

    w, x, y, z

    KtVec4()
    The default vector constructor.

    Constructs a vector from boolean values.

    Promotes a Vec3 to a KtVec4.
    KtVec4​(Vec3 v3, float w)
    Promotes a Vec3 to a KtVec4 with an extra component.

    Useful for multiplying a 4 x 4 matrix with either a 3D vector or a 3D point.
    KtVec4​(Vec4 source)
    Constructs a vector from a source vector's components.

      v3 - the vector

    • KtVec4

      public KtVec4​(Vec3 v3, float w)
      Promotes a Vec3 to a KtVec4 with an extra component.

      Useful for multiplying a 4 x 4 matrix with either a 3D vector or a 3D point. (For points, w is 1.0; for vectors, w is 0.0 .)
      Parameters:
      v3 - the vector
      w - the w component

    • KtVec4

      public KtVec4​(Vec4 source)
      Constructs a vector from a source vector's components.
      Parameters:
      source - the source vector

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(float v)
      Tests to see if the vector contains a value.
      Parameters:
      v - the value
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      Utils.approx(float, float)

    • dec

      public KtVec4 dec()
      Returns a new vector decremented by one. For interoperability with Kotlin: --a (prefix) or a-- (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the vector in place.
      Returns:
      the decremented vector

    • div

      public KtVec4 div​(float b)
      Returns a new vector with the division of the instance by the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a / b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the quotient

    • div

      public KtVec4 div​(Vec4 b)
      Returns a new vector with the division of the instance by the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a / b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the quotient

    • divAssign

      public void divAssign​(float b)
      Divides the instance by the right operand (mutates the vector in place). For interoperability with Kotlin: a /= b .
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand

    • divAssign

      public void divAssign​(Vec4 b)
      Divides the instance by the right operand (mutates the vector in place). For interoperability with Kotlin: a /= b .
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand

    • get

      public float get​(int index)
      Simulates bracket subscript access in an array. When the provided index is 3 or -1, returns w; 2 or -2, z; 1 or -3, y; 0 or -4, x.
      Parameters:
      index - the index
      Returns:
      the component at that index

    • inc

      public KtVec4 inc()
      Returns a new vector incremented by one. For interoperability with Kotlin: ++a (prefix) or a++ (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the vector in place.
      Returns:
      the incremented vector

    • set

      public void set​(int index, float value)

      value - the value

    • times

      public KtVec4 times​(float b)
      Returns a new vector with the product of the instance and the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product

    • times

      public KtVec4 times​(Mat4 b)
      Returns a new vector with the product of the instance and the right operand. Following GLSL convention, multiplies a vector and the transpose of a matrix.

      vT M = ( MT v )T

      For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product

    • times

      public KtVec4 times​(Vec4 b)
      Returns a new vector with the Hadamard product of the instance and the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product

    • timesAssign

      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
